conclusion: The problem involves determining the output power and total power of a power source connected to a small light bulb.
The graph shows two lines: a straight line representing the power source's U-I relationship and a curved line representing the light bulb's U-I relationship.
The intersection point of the two lines indicates the operating point where the power source and the light bulb are connected.
The intersection point is at \( I = 2 \, \text{A} \) and \( U = 2 \, \text{V} \).
At the intersection point, the output power of the power source is calculated as \( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I = 2 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 4 \, \text{W} \).
The y-intercept of the straight line (power source) is 3 V.
The total power of the power source is calculated as \( P_{\text{total}} = \text{emf} \times I = 3 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 6 \, \text{W} \).
The output power of the power source is \( 4 \, \text{W} \) and the total power of the power source is \( 6 \, \text{W} \).
